title: Access to Live Parts
fullText:
Live parts shall be arranged so that basic protection is provided by enclosures, in accordance with the provisions of Clause 1.5.4.
Exception: Live parts may be exposed in a non-domestic electrical installation provided that:
(a) the live parts are arranged so that basic protection is provided by barriers in accordance with the provisions of Clause 1.5.4.4; or
(b) the switchboard is installed in an area that is accessible only to authorized persons and the means of access to such areas is provided with facilities for locking.
In situations where the removal of covers and the like exposes live parts, such covers shall be identified in accordance with AS/NZS 3439.1 or AS/NZS 61439.1.
Exception: This requirement does not apply to domestic switchboards.
